title: How to write an emergency leave letter - Quora

response.answer_text: First of all. You never should have to write a leave letter at the moment the emergency happens. Just make sure you inform your boss or ask a college to do it for. Leave asap without putting anyone at risk from a injury perspective. First things first! An emergency can happen and everybody will understand. Don’t worry too much.  What you need to do is when things look better and you have some time: Follow of the formal HR process within your company. Often you need to follow a standardized process/workflow. Each business has its own procedure all though most off them are likewise. Often you need to fill in a form or write a formal letter. Don’t wait too long with this because you boss/manager needs to take steps to ensure you work continues. Some good examples of a leave letter you can find here in case you employer does provide you with one. Depending on what type of accident this was, your job or school may want to see the police report (if it was a car accident), or a note from your doctor (if it was an accident that required medical care). You would write a letter in addition to the above, and state what happened, the date and time it occurred, and how it has affected you, such as, how long you will be away from work/school while you recuperate. You would address your letter to your boss or human resources (if you are requesting leave from a job) or a teacher, professor, or principal (if you need to take time off from school). If your job or school responsibilities are such that you could work from home, and you are physically and mentally able to do this in your condition, you may want to consider offering to do some work from home. This will demonstrate that you still have your heart in the game.
